instructions: Image titled Back Up Your iPhone Step 11 1 Back up your iOS device . Image titled Update iOS Step 1 2 Open Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png Settings. It's a gray app with gears that's typically located on your home screen. Image titled Update iOS Step 2 3 Scroll down and tap Image titled Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png . Image titled Update iOS Step 3 4 Tap . It's at the top of the menu. Image titled Update iOS Step 4 5 Tap or . If a software update is already downloaded, the button will appear below the update description. You'll need to accept legal agreements before manually downloading the update. Image titled Update iOS Step 5 6 Enter your passcode if prompted. Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone. Your phone will restart and the update process will begin. In some cases, you may have to set up your phone again, although all your apps and data should be intact. Advertisement

Image titled Switch Iphones Step 13 1 Connect your device to your computer. Use the USB cable that came with your device. Tap on your device's screen if prompted after connecting. Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Backup your iPhone to iTunes before downloading any major update. That way, you can revert to the previous operating system, like iOS 12, if you don't like the new operating system, like iOS 13. Image titled Update iOS Step 7 2 Open iTunes. Do so if iTunes doesn't launch automatically when you connect your device. Image titled Update iOS Step 8 3 Click on your device's icon in the top bar of the window. It may take a moment to appear. Image titled Update iOS Step 9 4 Click on . Before updating, it's always advised to create a backup in case something goes wrong. This should only take a minute or two, and will allow you to restore your iOS device along with all your data if an error occurs during the update process. EXPERT TIP Chiara Corsaro Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. After you backup your phone to iTunes, turn iCloud back on. It's not obvious, but after backing up your iPhone to iTunes, you need to go to your phone settings, then iCloud settings, and then turn automatic iCloud backup back on. That way you have a constant backup of your phone even if you haven't done it through iTunes in a while. Image titled Update iOS Software on an iPad Step 17 5 Click on . You'll see this on the Summary page after selecting your iOS device. You may be prompted to update automatically when you first launch iTunes with your device connected. You'll see a notification if your device is already up to date. Image titled Update iOS Step 11 6 Click on . This will download the update to your computer, and apply it to your iOS device. This process may take a while, and you can monitor the progress of the update on your device's screen. Image titled Update iOS Step 12 7 Set up your device. After the update has been installed on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod, you'll need to complete it by entering your passcode or signing in with your Apple ID. If you installed a major update, you may be given a brief overview of the changes. Advertisement
